definitions: quality or state of dealing with things sensibly and realistically
examples: Her pragmatic approach to business helped the company survive
The team needed pragmatic solutions rather than theoretical ideas

definitions: philosophical movement or attitude emphasizing practical consequences as criteria of truth
examples: American pragmatism influenced educational reform in the twentieth century
Her pragmatism helped navigate complex political negotiations effectively

definitions: person who deals with things sensibly based on practical considerations
examples: The pragmatist on the committee focused on achievable goals
As a pragmatist, she evaluated policies by their results

definitions: large open area of grassland in North American plains regions
examples: Buffalo once roamed freely across the vast American prairie
Prairie restoration projects help preserve native grassland ecosystems today

definitions: expression of warm approval or admiration for someone or something
act of expressing worship or devotion especially to a deity
examples: The teacher's praise motivated students to work even harder
Critics offered high praise for the author's latest novel
The congregation joined together in praise and worship songs
Their morning prayers included praise for life's many blessings

definitions: wheeled vehicle for transporting babies or small children while walking
examples: She pushed the pram through the park every morning
The vintage pram had been in their family for generations

definitions: playful trick or mischievous act done for amusement
examples: The senior prank involved filling the principal's office with balloons
His harmless pranks kept everyone laughing during summer camp

definitions: person who plays pranks or practical jokes on others
examples: The office prankster struck again with rubber spiders everywhere
Known as a prankster, he kept his classmates constantly entertained

definitions: marine crustacean similar to shrimp but typically larger in size
examples: The restaurant served grilled prawns with garlic butter sauce
Fresh prawns were the highlight of their seafood platter

definitions: solemn request or expression addressed to a deity or sacred entity
earnest hope or wish for something to happen or succeed
examples: Morning prayer helped her find peace before starting work
The congregation recited prayers from their holy scripture together
Their only prayer was finding shelter before the storm
The team's prayer for victory seemed answered in overtime

definitions: person who delivers sermons or religious addresses to assembled groups
examples: The preacher delivered an inspiring sermon about forgiveness Sunday
As a traveling preacher, he visited rural churches monthly

definitions: delivery of sermons or religious addresses to assembled congregations
act of giving advice in an annoying or self-righteous way
examples: His preaching emphasized compassion and community service values
The minister's preaching drew large crowds every Sunday morning
Her constant preaching about healthy eating annoyed her friends
Nobody appreciated his preaching about proper work ethics constantly

definitions: preliminary or introductory statement in a document explaining its purpose
examples: The Constitution's preamble outlines the document's fundamental purposes clearly
After a lengthy preamble, she finally stated her request

definitions: action taken in advance to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant happening
examples: Wearing helmets is a basic precaution when riding motorcycles
The hospital took every precaution to prevent infection spread

definitions: condition of being considered more important than something else in order
examples: Safety takes precedence over speed in emergency evacuations
The CEO gave precedence to customer satisfaction over profits

definitions: earlier event or action serving as example or guide for similar circumstances
previous legal case or decision serving as authoritative rule in future cases
examples: This decision sets a dangerous precedent for future cases
There was no precedent for handling such unusual circumstances
The Supreme Court precedent influenced lower court decisions nationwide
Lawyers cited several precedents supporting their client's position strongly

definitions: rule or principle intended to regulate behavior or thought patterns
examples: The monastery followed ancient precepts passed down through centuries
Moral precepts shaped the community's approach to daily life

definitions: district of a city under a particular police station's jurisdiction
enclosed or clearly defined area around a building or place
examples: Officers from the fifth precinct responded to the emergency
The precinct captain addressed concerns at the community meeting
Visitors must register before entering the hospital precinct grounds
The cathedral precinct includes several historic buildings and gardens

definitions: very steep rock face or cliff dropping down sharply
examples: Hikers carefully approached the precipice to view the valley
The castle stood dramatically on a precipice overlooking the sea

definitions: water falling from clouds as rain, snow, sleet, or hail
process causing dissolved substance to form solid particles in solution
examples: Annual precipitation levels determine the region's agricultural potential significantly
The forecast predicted heavy precipitation throughout the weekend period
Chemical precipitation removed contaminants from the industrial wastewater effectively
Temperature changes caused precipitation of minerals in the solution

definitions: quality of being exact, accurate, and careful in details or measurements
examples: The surgeon worked with remarkable precision during the operation
Manufacturing these parts requires precision to thousandths of inches

definitions: condition that must exist or be established before something else can occur
examples: Trust is a precondition for any successful business partnership
Meeting certain preconditions was necessary for loan approval processing

definitions: substance from which another substance is formed through chemical processes
person or thing that comes before and indicates approach of another
examples: This protein serves as a precursor to several hormones
Scientists identified the precursor chemicals in the reaction sequence
The economic downturn was a precursor to major political changes
These symptoms often serve as precursors to migraine headaches

definitions: biological interaction where one organism hunts and consumes another organism
examples: Predation by wolves helps maintain healthy deer population levels
Marine biologists studied predation patterns in coral reef ecosystems

definitions: animal that naturally preys on other animals for food
person who ruthlessly exploits or takes advantage of others
examples: Lions are apex predators in African savanna ecosystems
The introduction of predators controlled the rabbit population effectively
Online predators target vulnerable teenagers through social media platforms
Financial predators exploited elderly victims with fraudulent investment schemes

definitions: person who held a job or office before the current holder
examples: Her predecessor left detailed notes about ongoing projects
The new CEO reversed many policies of his predecessor

definitions: difficult, unpleasant, or embarrassing situation from which escape seems hard
examples: Finding herself without money abroad was quite a predicament
The company's predicament worsened when investors withdrew their support

definitions: part of sentence containing verb and stating something about the subject
examples: In grammar class, students learned to identify subjects and predicates
The predicate 'ran quickly' tells what the subject did

definitions: quality of being able to be predicted or behaving in expected ways
examples: The predictability of weather patterns helps farmers plan planting
Market predictability decreased during the economic crisis significantly

definitions: statement about what will happen or might happen in the future
examples: Weather predictions for next week suggest heavy rainfall coming
Her prediction about market trends proved remarkably accurate later

definitions: thing or factor that indicates probable future events or outcomes
examples: Education level is a strong predictor of lifetime earnings
Blood pressure serves as a predictor of cardiovascular disease risk

definitions: preference or special liking for something arising from temperament or experience
examples: She had a predilection for Victorian literature and poetry
His predilection for spicy food was well known among friends

definitions: liability or tendency to suffer from particular condition or behave certain way
examples: Genetic testing revealed a predisposition to certain heart conditions
Her predisposition to anxiety made stressful situations particularly difficult

definitions: state of being greater in number, influence, or importance than others
examples: The predominance of technology companies changed Silicon Valley completely
Male predominance in engineering fields is slowly decreasing nationwide

definitions: fact of surpassing all others in importance, quality, or achievement
examples: The university maintained its preeminence in medical research globally
America's preeminence in space exploration began with moon landings

definitions: action of preempting or forestalling especially by prior right or action
principle allowing higher authority law to override lower authority law
examples: Military preemption prevented the enemy from launching their attack
The company's preemption of competitor strategies secured market dominance
Federal preemption invalidated the conflicting state environmental regulations
Constitutional preemption ensures national laws supersede local ordinances

definitions: building or structure manufactured in sections for quick assembly on site
examples: The prefab homes provided quick housing after the disaster
Modern prefab designs offer stylish and sustainable living options

definitions: introduction to a book typically stating its purpose and scope
examples: The author's preface explained her motivation for writing
In the preface, he thanked everyone who contributed help

definitions: greater liking for one alternative over another or others available
examples: Customer preferences shifted toward environmentally friendly products recently
She expressed a strong preference for working morning shifts

definitions: word element added at beginning of word to adjust or qualify meaning
examples: The prefix 'un-' changes happy to its opposite meaning
Medical terms often use Greek and Latin prefixes extensively

definitions: condition or period of being pregnant carrying developing offspring within body
examples: Her pregnancy progressed smoothly with regular prenatal care visits
The first pregnancy trimester often brings morning sickness symptoms

definitions: period of human history before written records were kept
examples: Archaeologists study prehistory through artifacts and fossil remains
Cave paintings provide glimpses into human prehistory and culture

definitions: preconceived opinion not based on reason or actual experience
harm or injury resulting from action or judgment of another
examples: Racial prejudice continues to affect hiring practices unfortunately
She overcame prejudice to become the company's first female CEO
The case was dismissed without prejudice to future claims
Actions taken to the prejudice of minority shareholders were challenged

definitions: action or event preceding or preparing for something more important
examples: Teams competed in preliminaries before the championship round
The preliminary hearing determined whether sufficient evidence existed

definitions: introductory piece of music typically before a larger musical work
action or event serving as introduction to something more important
examples: The pianist performed Chopin's prelude before the main sonata
Bach's preludes showcase intricate musical patterns and harmonies beautifully
These small protests were merely a prelude to revolution
Dark clouds gathering served as prelude to the storm

definitions: head of government especially in parliamentary systems or Canadian provinces
examples: The premier announced new economic policies at parliament today
Provincial premiers met to discuss national healthcare funding issues

definitions: first public performance or showing of a play, film, or production
examples: Celebrities attended the movie premiere in Hollywood last night
The opera's world premiere received standing ovations from audiences

definitions: position or period of being premier or prime minister
examples: During her premiership, major educational reforms were implemented nationwide
His premiership lasted through two successful election cycles

definitions: building and land occupied by a business or considered property
proposition from which conclusion is drawn in logical argument
examples: Security cameras monitor the entire premise twenty-four hours daily
No smoking is allowed anywhere on company premises
The argument's premise that all birds fly is clearly false
Your conclusion depends on accepting the initial premise completely

definitions: amount paid periodically for insurance coverage or policy
relating to superior quality commanding higher than usual price
amount added to ordinary price or charge for something special
examples: Monthly insurance premiums increased significantly this year
She pays health premiums through automatic bank withdrawals
Premium gasoline costs more but provides better engine performance
The airline offers premium seats with extra legroom
Buyers paid a premium for waterfront property locations
Collectors will pay premiums for rare vintage items
